snippet: Wlliam Baer, a lawyer at Arnold & Porter in Washington, would replace Sharis Pozen, the acting assistant attorney general for antitrust, who is expected to step down at the end of April.
abstract: Wlliam Baer, a lawyer at Arnold & Porter in Washington, would replace Sharis Pozen, the acting assistant attorney general for antitrust, who is expected to step down at the end of April.
lead_paragraph: The White House has nominated William Baer, a lawyer at Arnold & Porter in Washington, to run the Justice Department's antitrust division.

headline.main: White House Nominates Baer to Lead Antitrust Division
